title: Tortle
entryLore: Tortles are turtle-like humanoids who lead a simple and often nomadic life. Carrying their homes on their backs, they are exceptionally resilient and possess a calm, stoic nature. They are naturally adapted to both land and water, and their thick shells provide them with immediate and formidable protection from predators and foes alike.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: You can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the normal bludgeoning damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time.

traits.name: Natural Armor (Tortle)
traits.description: Your shell provides you with a base Armor Class of 17. You can gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a [[shield|Shield]], you can apply its bonus as normal.

traits.name: Shell Defense
traits.description: As an [[action|Action]], you can withdraw into your shell. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to your AC, and you have [[advantage|Advantage]] on Strength and Wisdom [[saving_throw|Saving Throws]]. While in your shell, you are [[prone_condition|Prone]], your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have [[disadvantage|Disadvantage]] on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take [[reaction|Reactions]], and the only action you can take is a [[bonus_action|Bonus Action]] to emerge.
